Row.Text: The Sambradrome is the Brazilian unique building, replacing the Stadium. It increases the [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness of the city. It cannot provide more [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness than there are [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in a city. Unlike the Stadium it replaces, the Sambadrome boosts [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism in the city. City must already have a Zoo.
Increases the [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism of a city. Only Brazil may build it.

Sambadrome (Samb√≥dromo in Portuguese language) is the name given to an exhibition place for the Samba schools parades during Carnaval in Brazil. A sambadrome generally consists of tiered spectator viewing areas surrounding a long alley for the schools to parade down. The parades attract many thousands of Brazilians and foreign tourists each year.
